content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
This is a comprehensive task. Let me break it down:

1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Pick the best new idea
3. Implement it as a new PopeBot skill in .pi/skills/
4. Write and execute a test to prove it works
5. Email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report

Let me start by exploring the repositories. I'll need to use the browser-tools skill to navigate these GitHub repos and understand what's there.

First, let me check what skills are already available and what I have access to. I should also check the llm-secrets skill to see what API keys I have available.

Let me start by reading the existing skills in the .pi/skills/ directory to understand the current architecture, then explore the GitHub repos.

content.text: I'll systematically explore these repositories, identify the best new idea, implement it as a skill, test it, and send you a progress report. Let me start by exploring what's available.

content.thinking: Good, I can see the current skills. Now let me explore the three repositories mentioned. I'll start by reading their key files to understand what tools, skills, and architectures they offer.
